Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 16th overall pick, by Columbus in 1976...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1980, off Bill Cook (BC)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/16/1980, off Mike Davis (BC)...
Won Outstanding Newcomer Award in 1980, hitting .261 with 25 HR, 97 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against New Jersey on 6/12/1981...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1981, hitting .417 with 2 HR, 13 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Pittsburgh on 6/23/1982...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Injured on 5/8/1983 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 4 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1983, hitting .458 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Drove in 8 runs against New Jersey on 6/13/1984...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/30/1985, hitting .520 with 0 HR, 10 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1985, hitting .344 with 5 HR, 24 RBI...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Drove in 7 runs against Bay City on 8/30/1985...
Won Outstanding Batter Award in 1985, hitting .292 with 35 HR, 129 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/2/1986 to a 5-year deal worth $5,152,800 per year...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Capital City on 4/25/1988...
Traded from Plum Grove to Pontiac on 6/22/1989 (Going to PON: LF T. Peterson. Going to PG: P P. Corrales, LF F. Rodriguez)...
